intro: Urtica adoensis, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is native to various regions across Africa and is characterized by its stinging hairs on its leaves and stems. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are heart-shaped with serrated edges and are often covered in fine, irritating hairs. Urtica adoensis produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are usually borne on erect inflorescences.
